product: Cura Desktop — AI-Powered Desktop Agent with Embedded Coding Agent & Meeting Intelligence
value_proposition: Cura is a desktop-native AI agent that captures meetings in stealth mode, extracts action items, and then actually executes them — on the user's machine. It has an embedded coding agent that can operate the computer autonomously: running scripts, automating desktop workflows, interacting with local apps and files. Integrations are MCP-based (Model Context Protocol) — Asana, Gmail, Calendar, QuickBooks, and more come built-in, but any MCP server can be added on request, making Cura extensible to virtually any tool a customer uses. Supports auto-approval mode or fully autonomous operation. Your admin team spends 2+ hours/day on post-meeting follow-up — Cura automates 80% of that. At $200-500/mo per seat, it pays for itself in the first week.

categories.name: Professional Services
categories.why: Meeting-heavy, admin-heavy. Office managers and EAs handle massive post-meeting task volume. Billable hour culture means time saved = revenue gained.

categories.name: Financial Advisory & Wealth Management
categories.why: 5-10 client meetings/day per advisor. Each generates compliance notes, action items, follow-ups. Paraplanners and CSAs spend hours on post-meeting admin.

categories.name: Healthcare & Medical Groups
categories.why: Practice managers, front desk staff, and medical office assistants handle scheduling, referrals, insurance follow-ups — all post-interaction admin on computers.
categories.admin_density: Very high — front desk + back office per location

categories.name: Software & Technology
categories.why: Engineering admins, TPMs, Chiefs of Staff manage sprint meetings, standup follow-ups, cross-team coordination. Mac-first culture, early adopters.
categories.admin_density: Medium — EAs, Chiefs of Staff, Program Managers

categories.name: Real Estate & Property Management
categories.why: Transaction coordinators process 50+ tasks per deal from meeting notes. High admin burden per transaction.

categories.name: Marketing & Creative Agencies
categories.why: Account managers attend client calls then spend hours creating briefs, updating project tools, sending follow-ups.

required_signals: Budget holder contactable (email or phone found)
Uses desktop computers (any OS — macOS, Windows, or Linux)
Meeting-heavy culture (evidenced by calendar tool usage, meeting tool subscriptions)
Uses SaaS/productivity tools that have or could have MCP servers (Asana, Monday, ClickUp, Salesforce, HubSpot, Slack, etc.)
Has administrative/assistant staff roles on LinkedIn
buying_triggers: Recently hired new admin staff (scaling pain)
Job postings for admin/assistant roles (capacity constrained)
Complaints about meeting overload on social media / Glassdoor
Currently using Otter.ai, Fireflies, or similar (aware of category but may want more)
Recent office expansion or new location
Using multiple SaaS tools (any tools — Cura's MCP architecture means we can integrate with virtually anything)
